Reviews.Title: This is the Stylus 1010 done right
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: *Updated: April 5, 2009I bought this camera as a replacement to my Stylus 1010 which I owned for a year.  The Stylus 9000 has pretty much addressed all of the issues I had with the 1010.  Here are some comparisons.Physical features: Put side by side the stylus 9000 is definitely bigger and heavier than the 1010, but that's no deal breaker especially since the 9000 has a sturdy metal body vice the plastic 1010 body.  The 9000 is also not as sleek looking as the 1010 but it fits better in your hand and the buttons are raised further so you can find them with your fingers more easily.Lens: The lens is a big improvement over the 1010 which most professionals will tell you is more important than having higher megapixels.  Besides offering extra zoom the 9000 lens is much beefier and offers wide angle shots.Media Card: It seems that Olympus has finally gotten over their proprietary high horse when it comes to XD media cards.  Both the 1010 and 9000 come with adapters to allow the use of Micro SD cards.  The problem with the 1010 was that if you wanted to take a panorama picture you had to have an OLYMPUS brand XD card.  This is not an issue with the 9000 as it allows you to take panorama shots with any card or even just the internal memory.  The 9000 also recognizes the higher write speeds of Class 4 and Class 6 Micro SD cards.  Which has solved one of the major head aches associated with VGA videos on the 1010 and its predecessors.Video: Both Cameras' offer VGA video recording size of 640x480 at 30 frames per second.  This feature is normally limited to 10 second clips with regular media cards.  The only way around this with the 1010 was to ensure your camera had the 1.1 firmware upgrade and to buy a more expensive XD type M+ card or type H card.  But because the 9000 recognizes the higher write speeds of the class 4 and 6 Micro SD's you can now record up to 20:00 min videos without having to purchase one of those high speed XD cards.Screen:  The 9000 comes with the 3rd generation hyper crystal display which is much brighter and gives you a clearer picture than the 1st generation display on the 1010.  I was very impressed with the visibility of the screen at high noon on a cloudless race day; I had no real problems taking or reviewing pictures. Though this screen is much better than that 1010 screen it's still not perfect especially considering the lack of a view finder.Battery life:  Both cameras utilize the same LI-50B battery.  I do admit that I haven't done any scientific side by side testing, but it seems as though the battery life on the Stylus 9000 is a bit shorter than the 1010.  This can be expected with a brighter screen and is kind of a tradeoff I guess.  It's hard for me to put an estimate on the battery life here because everyone uses their camera differently, but I would say you could comfortably shoot all day with the 9000 without needing a spare battery. (Unless of course you leave you camera on all the time, take hundreds of pictures ect, ect.)Operating software:  The 9000's menu looks different on the 1010's however the software interface is almost identical.  The 9000 does have a built in "beauty" feature, but it takes a lot of time for the camera to process the image, and it's something that is more suitably done on your computer with photo editing software.A note on camera cases:  I had an Olympus brand leather case that I could fit my Stylus 1010, a lens cleaning cloth, and a spare battery in with no issues.  Because the Stylus 9000 is bigger only the camera fits in that same case so the $30 camera case had to go the way of the old camera.  I also tried the Olympus Premium leather case with the same results.  So I am on a hunt for a quality case that I can fit all my accessories in.  I'll keep you posted.Overall:  I am very happy with this camera as a basic compact point and shoot.  It takes awesome pictures and is small enough to carry around even if you don't know if you'll need a camera.  I personally think the price is a little high on it right now, and it would be a great camera if you could get it for under $300.00.  Which I'm sure will happen sooner than later.

Reviews.Title: the camera I've been waiting 10 years for...
Reviews.Author: Vegas Slim
Reviews.Content: Finally a compact camera with a great zoom. I've had it a few days now and the photos on the automatic settings are wonderful. The camera also lets you adjust most all parameters to "be creative." This camera will be perfect for travel. The LCD is bright and the controls are intuitive. No more carrying my larger Sony with the bulky (10x) lens. The software is just ok, but I generally use third party applications anyway. I am not a pro, just someone who travels a lot and takes photos to share with others. I'll be taking this camera to Europe next month so I'll update the review if I run into any issues.

Reviews.Title: Quite Pleased . . .
Reviews.Author: Don Juan Filipe Del Helado Cortez "Friend and...
Reviews.Content: Love the camera!Its important to note what I was looking for when I purchased this.  I wanted: 1) COMPACT, 2) High Optical Zoom, 3) Shooting Modes, 4) Ease of use 5) CHEAP ( I bought this camera for $300, $175 of it with gift certificates I already had, so I ended up paying like $125 all in all.  I wanted an IDIOT-PROOF camera because I am NOT a professional photographer and have neither the time, nor the inclination to learn about aperture or shutter speed and one that I could travel with easily (put in my pocket).  I wanted something that would be fast, simple and effective and this little guy hits all the marks.  The pictures are clean and good and its super easy to use.Im gonna make it super easy.  Pros and cons . . .PROS:Zoom: The zoom is fantastic.  It does exactly what I expected it to: The 10x Optical is rocking good!  Clarity is awesome and Im very satisfied with the lack of pixillation.Size: I love the fact that, in accordance with Olympus' other 'pocket-sized cameras,' I can put it in my pocket, no problem.Panorama and Shooting Modes: Ive had three previous Olympus cameras and Im in total love with the shooting modes.  The in-camera panorama is great and I find myself using it a lot.  Beauty mode is quite useful, too, I find.CONS:Olympus has a few bad marks against it in my mind.  First, its customer service sucks - just TRY to get your camera serviced or a question answered and youll see what I mean.  Second, these cameras are delicate, to say the least - my first cameras' flash broke irreparably after the first year and a half and the second one ate it when a little water splashed on it.  Just handle them carefully.  Finally, Olympus compacts are notorious for taking AWESOME pictures in the daylight hours (dawn and dusk included) but you really have to focus on what your doing at night.  If your using the flash, no problem, but if you wanna take pics of anything without it at night, youll have to work for it.Other than that, the only major con that I can come up with is the size.  The size IS good for fitting it into your pocket (which is why I listed it above, too) but its a little bulkier than I would have hoped.  Its just bigger than Olympus' FE line cameras, for those who are familiar with them.All in all, Im very satisfied and would recommend this camera for those who have the same photographic purposes as I.  You may want to wait for the price to come down, though :)

Reviews.Title: Great new Olympus Stylus 9000
Reviews.Author: M. Friedman
Reviews.Content: I dropped my last Olympus Stylus in water and ruined it. I had bought it about 4 years ago and loved it. I was looking for the same thing, but found that cameras have advanced a lot since then. My old one only had a 3X zoom and 8 MP. The new Olympus Stylus 9000 has a 10X zoom and 12 MP which you can change to many lower MP settings to increase the number of photos the card holds. The battery is slimmer and the recharger is much more compact. I'm still getting used to using this camera, but so far I'm enjoying it even more than my old camera. Nice new and more compact dials. The photos are excellent!!

Reviews.Title: Terrible flash photos
Reviews.Author: Gary S.
Reviews.Content: I just bought the 9000 and used it at a church wedding.  I also brought along my Canon A95.  The Stylus-9000 photos were grainy, the colors looked harsh and the background area was dark.  By contrast, the Canon photos were very clean and sharp, the colors looked more pleasing and the lighting was even throughout the photo, even in the background.  The two cameras were used from the same location, same church lighting. I also tried using the 9000 without flash, and the pictures looked much better (than with flash) except I usually could not hold it steady enough so the photos were either slighty or very blurred, even with the stablizer on.The photos of the 9000 taken outside in bright sunlight were fine.I'm returning the Olympus 9000.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000
Reviews.Author: Gary L. Knepper
Reviews.Content: Well once again I am very very pleased with my new Olympus Stylus 9000 camera. I used their trade up plan and traded in my Olympus Stylus 840 which was a great camera also, but I wanted the better features on the Olympus 9000 such as the 12 megapixels and the 10X optical zoom lens. Also I got a fairly decent price when I traded in the 840 model. My Great Niece got married in an outdoor wedding in Pa. a few days after I got the new camera and I had little time to try out the new features on the new Olympus 9000 camera before I went to the wedding. But I had totally no problems. Olympus cameras are totally user friendly and unlike many cameras they come with a printed hands on instruction manual. I love that feature but truthufully if you know anything about digital cameras you will have little trouble operating the Olympus brands. One thing I was totally surprised about and was amazed at was that we were all seated quite far away from the actual marriage ceremony. The wedding was on a little island on a small lake and the guests were on the shore of the lake. I held my little camera above the seated folks heads, with my arms extended straight up as far as I could reach, and was still able to see the screen and took some really really great pictures at 10X zoom. I was almost certain I would not be able to hold the camera steady at 10X zoom but the double stabilization did great and I didn't get one blurry photo and I am a shaky 64 year old man. I could go on and on about the different features on this camera but trust me, it is loaded down with nice and easy to use features. The price and size of this camera are great too. It is a true shirt pocket sized camera with big camera features and qualities. And remember when it comes to seeing the viewing screen in bright sunlight or any light, Olympus wrote the book on being able to see the screen in all light conditions. The only thing a few folks complain about is that Olympus still uses the XD cards. I don't know why this is a problem to some people as it matters not to me. They are readily available at many places and you really only need one 2 GB size card or at the most 2 cards. The battery life is also senstional and they came out with a new charger without a cord which is great. You will not be disappointed if you decide to buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera with BIG features, the macro shots are fantastic!
Reviews.Author: Spenda Buck "My Humble Opinion"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this little compact camera I was expecting to later have to buy a bigger more powerful one, but when I used it, I discovered that this little camera does a BIG job!  The range from 10x optical zoom to the closest of close ups is remarkable!  I can get it to focus on the inside of a flower at 1/4 inch away.  That's right, 1/4 inch away.  I can't believe it, but it does it!I have problems seeing up close and I thought that I'd have a hard time seeing the LED screen for shots, but again, I was surprised, I can see it pretty well!I find it to be deserving of the phrase "Packed with Features".  From the "Beauty" setting that softens wrinkles and blemishes, to the timer, to the settings that allow you to create just what you want if the "Auto" setting isn't creative enough, this camera fills the bill.The battery life seems good to me, but I bought two batteries and chargers so that if one goes dead I have a backup.I'm very impressed and would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fifty-Fifty
Reviews.Author: Neroos
Reviews.Content: Loved the features the Olympus Stylus 9000 has. I really liked the 10x zoom, it's panoramic photos processed right in the camera, super macro mode and many others. Unfortunately, the one I would use the most was a hit-and-miss for taking good photos. In AUTO mode you really have no control on what the camera focuses on, thus causing many blurry images. It was not camera shake nor zooming that caused the blur. I had the camera for 3 weeks and after testing it on many shots I finally gave up and returned the camera. Bummer, I really wanted that camera!I gave the camera a 3 star rating as half the photos came out clear and the other half blurry.

Reviews.Title: No camera is perfect
Reviews.Author: Joseph Tague
Reviews.Content: Ok, so let me start out by saying that "no camera is perfect". Believe me I'm exhausted from reading reviews and tech data on many cameras. ........and no camera met all my criteria, specifically, finding a camera that had a wide angle (28mm) and aperture priority at the same time. So I gave up a little creative control for the wide angle. My reasoning was that I bicycle long distance and just wanted a camera that I can pull out quick and shoot a photo op while riding. I have all the old cameras with multiple lens and know what it is like to carry around big bulky equipment and have to pull it all out of a large camera bag.However there were a few other flaws on this camera that I was willing to overlook also. When using the flash you have to be at least into ISO 200 or you will be severely limited in your range. ...........and ISO 400 if your using the zoom. At ISO 400 you start seeing the noise (grain). Above ISO 400 pictures are not acceptable. Most of my shooting is outdoors. When using the zoom the AF seems to struggle and some pictures come out blurry. So you have to be cognizant of that and sometimes work (in some compositions, not all by any means) to get the picture by playing with or adjusting the composition or possibly changing the AF from "spot" to "ESP" and vice versa. I've read other reviews where many have said that the picture quality is a little soft. Well not sure if I would call it soft but what struck me right away is that most pictures fall short on "contrast". So if I bring the pictures into the image application and edit them by increasing the contrast they really "POP!".The picture quality, the AF issue, and the ISO/Flash issue are all resolvable issues with "work arounds" and compromises because as I said in the beginning "no camera is perfect", ......and they will all have their own unique issues unless you want to spend big, big, bucks. Otherwise the camera structure, the features, the wide angle, the 10X zoom, the 12 MP. The LCD screen., the size and portability all played a roll in selecting this camera.

Reviews.Title: Super camera for the balance between features and portability
Reviews.Author: C. LILYA
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife to replace our seven year old Canon S40 with a newer, more capable camera. The Canon has been a great camera for us, but this thing is amazing!I also bought an extra battery and instead of buying the Olympus proprietary XD card (only 2GB), I bought a 16GB micro SD. I also bought a micro SD to XD adapter.This camera has been great. It's small enough that I don't feel like it's a huge consideration to take it anywhere we go, and it has a super fast start up, making it ready to go right away. The 10X zoom on this size of camera is amazing. It takes great pictures, the colors come out great, and shooting video is super as well. My wife and I both like the evolution of the buttons and displays on the camera. They are much more intuitive and easier to navigate than our previous camera or a number of digitals that we've tested before. My only caveat is that under lower light settings, zoomed pictures may come out a little fuzzy because there just isn't enough light and the flash won't compensate that far away. When turning the flash off for longer shots like that, there is also a slight delay on the shutter, so practicing a little with a moving subject to get an idea of how much to anticipate is not a bad idea.We haven't played with the smile recognition for self-portrait timer shots or some of the other gee whiz capabilities. We will, but thusfar it has been used for the 98% of what we need a camera for: quickly and easily taking pictures of our family while traveling or participating in other events.In summary, this camera is a heckuva performer as a versatile and portable point and shoot. We highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Quite a disappointment
Reviews.Author: CTB "60s freak"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from[...] a few weeks ago.  It was on sale for $179.99, which I considered to be quite a bargain.  I was looking for a camera with a fairly large zoom (in this case 10X).  I read a a number of critical reviews on sources other than Amazon.com and [...] (mostly photography specific review sites). I decided to take the leap mostly based on the great price.It was intended mostly for taking photos of my children at sporting events such as soccer where a 3X or 4X zoom proves to be inadequate.After a few days with the camera, I decided to return it to Costco and purchased a slightly more expensive Panasonic (DMC-ZS3) for $249.99 (also at Costco).While I didn't necessarily want to spend the extra $70, the Olympus was unacceptable and needed to be returned ASAP.  Before purchasing the camera, I researched the features. Just about every camera on the photography review websites is rated 3.5 stars.  I needed to read into the specifics of each review to get the true story.  Drilling down into the specific reviews on this Olympus, the main concerns seemed to be:1. Use of expensive and small (in terms of GB) Olympus specific memory cards.2. Trouble focusing.3. Poor performance with flash.4. problem with memory cards corrupting images.The #1 problem was that about 50% of the photos I took were corrupted images.  That is to say, when reviewing photos on the camera, it would say something like "data corrupted."  Obviously this was unacceptable.  After taking about 100 images, I deleted the 40 - 50 that were corrupted.The #2 issue was trouble focusing. Lots of pictures were blurry, which made no sense with a camera with such a high pixel count.I really wanted to like this camera (again, the price was fantastic for the features it had).  I'd never had a corrupt image problem before on any of the 5 or so digital cameras I have owned.FYI, so far, I love the Panasonic and would recommend it to anyone looking for a camera to fill the same niche (megazoom, big pixel count, etc....).

Reviews.Title: Love it/hate it
Reviews.Author: G. D. Gant
Reviews.Content: Love it:A beautifully put together, substantial and versatile point and shoot digital camera.  And it is so much more with a little forethought about what and where you are going to be shooting.  The pictures, so far, have been everything I could possibly want.  The zoom is amazing.  The clarity and brightness of the image on the screen is unbelievable compared with my old Olympus C5000.Hate it:The instruction manual is almost as clear as mud - however, I suspect that to a young person familiar with all kinds of joy stick operations that it might likely be as clear as a fresh mountain stream - and possibly never needed.  Also, the physical travel distance between wide angle and telephoto is very short so it is hard to get just the right length for the composition desired.It's also going to take time for a died-in-the-wool SLR user to get used to no view finder.  The physical position required to hold the camera to the eye is a very stabilizing one.  It is good for composing as well as for stabilizing the camera.  The 9000  takes care of the stabilizing, but waving that heavy little gizmo at arm's length trying to get the composition exactly right - and for long enough to take the shot - is going to take a lot more practice.

Reviews.Title: Noise Quality Pictures
Reviews.Author: artgirl82 "Art Girl"
Reviews.Content: I am a semi-pro photographer - I own a Canon Rebel SLR - I wanted a decent point and shoot camera so that I didn't have to drag my SLR to family outings and such - After many camera reviews - I decided on the Olympus Stylus 9000. I picked it because it had auto settings but it also had settings that I could change and control myself. I got it today and tonight after looking at the images on my computer, I am returning it.Overall the camera is very easy to use. It's a bit slippery in your hands. I think that it could be easy to drop. There is no viewfinder window - just the LCD monitor. Another thing I don't like is that the memory card you put into it - is a xd card - you have to buy Olympus brand xd card - and the largest size xd card they sell is 2 GB. With the highest picture quality setting set - you won't be fitting that many images on it -The camera does come with a rechargeable battery and battery charger. It also comes with a microsd converter.It is very stylish - most of the functions worked well - I noticed when I was taking pictures that the shutter speed was a little sluggish - I am used to my SLR though - I also noticed that the time to record the images was slower than my SLR - Someone used to point and shoot cameras might think it faster than their current camera.Auto mode - I would stay away from this - the camera doesn't know what to focus on and so you end up with a lot of blurry pictures. Camera shake is not due to this.The reason I am returning this camera is that when looking at the images on my computer - there is A LOT of noise. Noise is kind of a grainy quality to the pictures - You really don't notice this until you look at the image at 100%. Just looking at the images in the preview mode - because they are not viewed at 100% - you don't notice it as much - but when you look at your image in full size - its horrible. I was so disappointed. I had the camera on the highest quality picture at 12 mp - at higher ISO's the noise gets worse. Night shots and shots that have low lighting are really bad - shots with plenty of light - you don't notice this as much - but it is still there.I won't put up with this kind of quality. Back to Amazon it goes.

Reviews.Title: WANT to like it, but just not completely SOLD!
Reviews.Author: L. Merrick "My 4 Boys MOM"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a new camera that was compact and had a big zoom (10x on this one).  There are really only 3 in the market that I would buy, and only 2 at Costco where I would buy this.I got this for Xmas, used it all night, and most fo the next day after going through the manual completely.Pro's:Very Cool Features:  Super Macro, Panorama (2 modes) 10x Zoom, small size, Cutesey Features: Beauty Mode, Red eye Remove, Eye Sparkle, Quick Scene modesLong Battery Life, Sturdy Camera, Strong Flash, and 3 flash modes + you can turn flash off.Con's:50% of pictures in Auto Mode come out blurry, Often the camera takes 2-3x of "1/2" presses to figure out what to focus on, The 2gb xd card is not very fast (when trasferring to computer), Sports Mode is entirely uselessBottom line- If you have optimum conditions (Still subject, fill flash used, daytime) it can take down right awesome pictures. And that Super Macro mode (up to .5" away)- it's impressive.  But if you are photographing kids with maxed zoom and in motion, or less than FULL light conditions... it is not that impressive.  For this price, and my expectations, I am going to check out the other models in the High Zoom category.The lesser Olympus FE-340 had better picture clarity.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME for the price
Reviews.Author: scientific mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about 8 months ago to keep in my purse. (Completely protected in a hard case.) We also have a 6MP digital Canon SLR we bought in 2003 that was SO expensive at the time, and this camera is BETTER and 1/4 the price (over $1000 vs $266). The 10x zoom is the equivilant of a 280mm zoom lens. Obviously this camera also has 12MP. I can't believe you can get this kind of MP and zoom in a pocket camera. The color and clarity are excellent, even when using it as a camcorder.  It picks up the various hughs of a rainbow better than my naked eye. I have recently used the "sun" (bright) mode taking photos of the snow, and it is an unbelievable difference from using a "regular" mode, which is just all bright white. Our SLR does not have a pre-set "sun" or "bright" mode - you would have to manually configure such a thing.The camera itself is compact and sturdy. The viewing window is huge and the controls are user-friendly. The on/off, photo snap, and zoom are all convient to the trigger-finger, but not so close that you accidentally bump one while using another. I do dislike that you have to change from "picture taking" mode to "picture viewing" mode to delete a photo you just took if you don't like it, but this isn't a major issue for me.I only have two complaints. One is, you cannot zoom while you are using it as a camcorder. You need to zoom to the level you want before recording, and if whatever you are recording moves closer or further from you, you are, well, SOL! I don't think it is a limitation of the hardware, I think they just didn't include it in the internal software. Second, the battery doesn't keep a very good charge after just 6 months. And I was NOT using it extensively in either photo or video mode. The battery is not part of the warranty. But you can pick up knock-off batteries (which reviewers say also only have a rechargable life of about 6 months) for $6-$7 apiece, vs the "Canon" brand battery at $40.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong with this one
Reviews.Author: La Petisa
Reviews.Content: I have had Olympus cameras for many years.  I've never had anything go wrong with them and I have always been pleased with the quality of photos.  This summer I bought this pocket sized Olympus for a two week cruise and I'm extremely pleased.  At 12 MP and 10x Optical Zoom this little thing is a dream!  Add in the image stabilizer for those of us with shaky hands and you'll appreciate this camera even more.This camera has so many features that I'm still learning them three months after having the camera.  One feature that I love is that I can record a voice snippit for each photo so that years later I can remember the context of the picture.Can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Stunning and warm photos - switched from Canon
Reviews.Author: Grady Tucker
Reviews.Content: I have been a huge Canon Digital camera fan for years and have owned about four cameras. They take great photos, very clear and precise. But they don't handle tough lighting conditions as well as the Olympus cameras.Olympus has clearly put a lot of effort and technology to creating not only crystal clear photos but keeps the warmth of skin tones and it manages back lighting, sport shots and bright flash much better than the canons do.You can even shoot through a store window, with flash, and get a good shot.The prices for these cameras are fantastic. They are a huge value.Buy it, try it, love it.Grady

Reviews.Title: Amazon, Olympus 9000
Reviews.Author: Edward J. Vansciver
Reviews.Content: I found Amazon very helpful in finding the right price and the right dealer and the quickest delivery, (next day),. The Olympus 9000 Stylus model is an awesome digital camera. It has all the features you could only dream of.Check it out! I did compare it with other brands, for the size and easy set up and use this won hands down.You can't go wrong for all the service and assistance you receive. Software is easy as well. I cannot say enough about my experience.

Reviews.Title: Replacement Camera
Reviews.Author: Diane M.
Reviews.Content: This camera is easy to use, great pictures, downloads easily. Batteries hold a long charge, it's small and compact. The only negative so far is that when taking multiple pics in succession there is a lag time and camera will not take the picture.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000 Wife's Better Pic's
Reviews.Author: wbent44 "Charley"
Reviews.Content: Got this for wife.  She had alot of trouble using regular SLR type cameras (blur).With the 9000 she takes wonderful photos,; very professional looking.Camera is small enough to take everywhere and battery life is amazing.Focusing system and color are quite accurate. Even videos turn out pretty good. Controls seem logical.  Cons: Flash is located where finger sometimes sits. This may tone down flash.  It's a bit slow when light gets low.I'm happy that she's happy. And we always have it for that specail shot.

Reviews.Title: My second Olympus
Reviews.Author: HonestAbe
Reviews.Content: So back in Nov 2010 i bought an Olympus Stylus 7010 12mp and a Sony dsc-w350 14mp with the idea of comparing the two and keeping the one i like (amazon prime is awesome).  Hands down the olympus had sharper pictures so i kept that one and sent the sony back.  Then in May my girlfriend broke my camera, i had a square trade warranty so no problem, got all my money back.  This time same scenario but two new cameras.  I bought a Sony Cyber-shot DSC-HX5V 10.2MP and the Olympus Stylus 9000 12MP.  I did this at the beginning of august and compared the two when i got them.  The sony was much, much, much better.  However it was about $200, well worth it.  There were two features i was counting on, those being low light pics and panorama pics.  The Sony does extremely well at both of these.  I am still amazed by the way it manages shadows and background lights in low light shots.  The pan pics are seamless and all pics are very well detailed and sharp.  All in all in the last 11 months i have tried four different point and shoot cameras ranging from $130 to $200 and my advice for anyone looking for performance out of a point and shoot, spend the 200 bucks and get the sony.  Nothing else compares.  Also I read an article about how more megapixels in a point and shoot camera can be detrimental.  In P&S; cameras the chip is usually limited on size so by adding more pixels to the chip you lessen the amount of light going to each pixel.  So less light equals less details in the picture.  I would suggest keeping it around the 10 to 12mp area for the best results.  Hope this Helps.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000
Reviews.Author: Camera Mitz "Cam Mitz"
Reviews.Content: Overall: its a good camera.Pros: good zoom, good display, simplified quite a bit from the Stylus 1010.  i like the in camera editing on the beauty setting.Cons: a little big, kinda fat and heavy (i realize its cause of the zoom and all that)  also it did not come with a Micro SD to xD converter card like the S 1010.Score: 7.5 of 10

Reviews.Title: Some decent features, but wouldn't recommend
Reviews.Author: V. Berisford
Reviews.Content: I've had my Olympus Stylus-9000 for a little over a year. Recently some smallish issues have compounded to make the camera basically unusable. First, the good stuff: I love the 10x optical zoom. When I bought the camera, there was really nothing that compared to that in it's price range. Outdoor and low-light, slow-speed pictures come out great. I never had any problems with battery life. I took it on a two week vacation; I zoomed in and out and turned the camera on and off all day long and only had to charge the battery twice. The controls are straightforward and the size makes it perfect to stuff in your jeans pocket.Now the bad: first and foremost, the camera (or at least mine) simply isn't durable. I had the camera for a little over a year (just long enough to pass the warranty period, natch) and developed a few problems that gradually evolved into major problems. The LCD screen (which I thought was great originally) developed a jittery static problem that was only intermittent at first. Eventually this got worse and worse until now the screen is rarely visible and I have to take pictures "blind". Also, whatever feature it was that was providing the stabilization for zoomed in pictures stopped working, which makes the 10x zoom pretty much useless unless you have something to rest the camera on. Someone else mentioned this and I agree: the camera does not take good indoor pictures. Using the iAuto function, you get pictures that are overflashed; there seems to be no mechanism to correlate flash strength with subject distance. Switching to manual mode will eventually get you a decent picture, but who wants to tweek settings when the auto feature should be doing that for you? Flash free indoor pictures (which I resorted to after the overflashing) are grainy and the image stabilization does not do much if anything to correct the natural blur that comes with hand held low shutter speed pics.In short, my camera broke. After reading the reviews here, this doesn't seem to be a common problem; maybe I just have bad luck. If I were happy with the camera overall, I would certainly be willing to buy another of the same model, but I am not. The camera simply isn't that great. I will be buying a differnt camera this time around.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased. Quality camera at a great value.
Reviews.Author: TK
Reviews.Content: This camera is high quality for the price tag. The features are up-to-date, and all the ones I've tried have worked as they were promised, and I was pleased with the quality, speed and high capacity of supported storage devices. The only drawback is that the battery needs to be removed and charged in a separate device (which is fairly small and lightweight). While this is an inconvenience, I imagine it is to cut down on the unit size/weight. Frequent travelers may find this better than a bulky docking station.

Reviews.Title: best camera I've ever had
Reviews.Author: L Scheuer
Reviews.Content: I take pix all day every day.  I'm a visual artist, photographer, illustrator, blogger.I've never enjoyed a camera as much as I've enjoyed this one.For the price,  I find the lens quality to be outstanding, the zoom is sufficient, the macro and super-macro are wonderful tools.I've tried Canon digital cameras, kodak digital cameras... they just don't hold a candle to Olympus.Dropped this camera in the pond yesterday (waterproof is not one of its features) , and am buying a brand new one today.Can't live without it.

Reviews.Title: NICE Camera.
Reviews.Author: Dave Holub
Reviews.Content: I was buying my first digital p/s camera.  Serious contenders were Nikon 570, Sony and Canon.  I have an Olympus Stylus 35mm p/s and like it a lot.  This thing is really cool and has a good feature set.  I checked out all settings and I'm pleased.  The battery life at first was not great, but that was due to learning the camera - now its better as no time is wasted fooling around.  Pictures were great on the whole - the few questionable ones were due to not being familiar with the digital photo world.  On the whole, I'd recommend this camera to anyone.  The software is fun as well.

Reviews.Title: Fast camera with good picture quality
Reviews.Author: J. Lu
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very good. But the best thing about this camera is the quick response. Cold start to first picture is about 2 seconds, which is pretty good. The "quick sequence" feature is great to have when there's a lot of action going on, but there's no flash so make sure there is lots of ambient light.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Amlover "Amlover"
Reviews.Content: This camera is compact with large zoom and economic price. The quality of picture is pretty good. The only thing not very good is the low power flash, which made indoor pictures dull.

Reviews.Title: Dont Buy This Camera
Reviews.Author: Kara S. Christianson
Reviews.Content: I'm a graphic designer and wanted a good digital camera to capture photos. The features are what sold me on this purchase.The camera doesn't focus... ever. The images are blurry, the color is poor. I have tried adjusting it and so have many others.Indoors is almost impossible to get a clear shot. There  were 5 of us at an indoor soccer game and no one could take a decent photo with this camera.Look elsewhere for a quality digital camera.

Reviews.Title: A "GOOD" CAMERA...
Reviews.Author: Phillip R. "PRS"
Reviews.Content: I was recently coming from a Digital Canon Rebel 8.0 which was an SLR, so It shouldn't be something to compare this Olympus too, so I will try not to be biased. I have owned a lot of "Pocket" Digital cameras, mostly Canons. I bought this one based on the good reviews and a friend of mine had it and said it was great. It feels a little bit bulky, it's a little wide compared to others on the market, but it's still small enough to throw in a bag without taking up "real" space. The panoramic feature is sort of fun, but also a little cheesy and not always accurate, the navigation feels a little tedious and more work than it should be. The colors of the pictures are fairly accurate, overall it's an okay camera. I definitely would recommend other cameras over this one. I am usually hesitant when there are added gimmicks, and it proved to be true in this case, it did not live up to my expectations and I sold it to buy a Canon Powershot.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: Diana L
Reviews.Content: I like the overall look of pictures taken with Olympus cameras, so I looked for a small Olympus camera with a 10-zoom feature to replace my Olympus 750-Ultra Zoom, which was dropped one too many times. I'm used to a view finder, so I'm not sure how well I'll like using the preview window instead. I've had to get reading glasses recently, so I hope I can see the screen well enough to take good pictures. I've tested it locally, but everything is different when you're on vacation and in a rush. Other than that, the 10-zoom feature is perfect and the camera size is amazingly small, so I'm really happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Awsome zoom and winde angle for a point and shoot camera!!
Reviews.Author: Ghanshyam H. Popat "GHP"
Reviews.Content: Very good image quality with 10X zoom and wide angle lens makes this camera very compelling.  Little bit bigger than comparable Canon and other point and shoot cameras.

Reviews.Title: Decent photos for everyday use
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: I wish that I could say that I liked this model as much as my older Olympus Stylus. I might just need to play around with the functions more, but I get weird hues/color-tones when I'm taking macro-photos of small, detailed items, and indoors. I need these photos for my work--high-detailed shots of small items (hairline-detail required for jewelry photography). This camera is great with capturing the details, but gold pieces often look like bronze, silver pieces can look blue.My older Stylus (X-840) was excellent, and the only reason why I upgraded (or thought that I was upgrading) was the terrible battery life on the other camera. This camera, the 9000, at least has a very good battery life on its re-chargeable Lithium battery.Otherwise, for everyday photos, playing tourist or just out and about, my photos with this camera have been very good.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Frankcruzrbike
Reviews.Content: This camera is one of the reasons why I don't own an 'everything in one' cellphone/camera/mp3 player.  I have beautiful mountain views and I raise some very interesting flowering cactus plus the wild flowers are special in the desert.  All that and my loved ones too.  This camera catches all.

Reviews.Title: Used once and quit
Reviews.Author: jrobinso
Reviews.Content: I researched several cameras and went with the Olympus Stylus 9000.  I took 6 photos with the camera and it totally shut down.  Every time I power it up, it beeps and shuts off.  I thought it was the battery so I tried a new battery and that did not work, thought maybe it was the charger not charging the battery but without buying another charger, that is hard to prove.  I finally gave up and contacted Olympus.  They informed me that the "average" cost of repair for this camera is $94.  I paid $139.

Reviews.Title: olympus cameras
Reviews.Author: Toni
Reviews.Content: awsome camera to use. easy and no blurred pictures . sharp images and you can take pictures quick. would not by another brand. they are they best. great quality!

Reviews.Title: utter disappointment
Reviews.Author: apbrandt
Reviews.Content: this is my 3rd olympus camera purchase. i stuck with the brand thinking that perhaps my first two experiences were bad luck or poor care of my camera. i have owned this camera for less than 6 months and it is already in need of repair/replacement. the lense is exended (in camera mode) and will not retract. the camera will not take pictures, but does allow you to view the pictures on the card. this is incredibly frustrating, especially with this being the exact issue my previous olympus camera experienced thus leading me to replace it with the stylus-9000. big mistake! now that i realize that this is a manufacturing issue and not an individual issue i know better than to buy this brand again. the picture quality is not superior either.olympus will repair my issue but i am out the cost of shipping them the camera and 2 months to complete the repair.

Reviews.Title: FAV CAMERA FOR A PICKY PHOTOGRAPHER
Reviews.Author: S. FONKEN
Reviews.Content: I've been through a bit of cameras til I came to this one.  I wanted a camera that has crisp pictures without having to use flash all the time. I also wanted one that could take night shots all the same with or without flash. I came back to the olympus family line. This camera takes beautiful pictures, has focus help. I have children so I take pictures alot. My children don't stand still, but this camera manages to capture them anyway most the time without the flash. With the flash the pictures come real crisp and fast without too much lighting from the flash. It has beauty shot that will take away imperfections from vain picture taking. The buttons and setup are awesome, I am so pleased with how easy it is, and how good it looks.  The battery lasts so long that I forget it needs charging.  The quality of the picture is more than enough.  I suppose the only draw back would be that you need to have a special memory card for olympus.  But I trust olympus cameras, they never break , last forever... and take pictures that look like your right there and now... This camera has given me no problems whatsoever. And has been manhandled by my little one. It Also by the way takes great video too ... the video picture is vivid and bright. There are many cameras out there where picture is what it will be but the video is horrific. This one , you can even work with the light settings and shadow cast away and white balance. I love it. I need alot from a camera that is gonna be taking my perfect pictures of my children; the joy of my life; and this is it. I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Holly
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday and spent quite a bit of time playing around with it.  So far it seems great!  I was taking pictures of my very active children last night and didn't get one blurry shot.  All my pictures came out clear and vibrant.  The menu and different features are very user friendly.  I was a little afraid to buy this camera because of some of the bad reviews and I was worried because the price so cheap, but so far it looks like I got a great deal.

Reviews.Title: fits my needs
Reviews.Author: shafted
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera 5 stars for 1 reason,it does exactly what I need,I did not purchase this looking for professional results,nor did I expect outlandish performance,this is a good 10x optical zoom ,quick, well built,digital point and shoot, as it implies,which has minimal settings,simple to use,excellent picture quality,mostly used outdoors,perfect for vacations,short trips,quick grab, take picture camera, If you are looking for DSLR quality,buy a DSLR ,if you just want a good all around, easy to use, with a good zoom for the price, just to take everyday pictures ,I can tell you,it will not disappoint...

Reviews.Title: A bit of advice
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera! My only complaint is that Olympus has you buy a "special" memory card- you can't just use a standard one. I wish I had known beforehand.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: J. King "JK"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for anyone who has had a Olympus Stylus in the past.  After buying this i had so many people asking me about it that three family members went out and got the same camera. I think it is the best camera on the market right now. It comes with a XD card reader that a Micro SD card can be put into and than used with the camera. Great idea since the Micro SD card come in 8 gigs. great camera.

Reviews.Title: What a deal ... elite features at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Turtles all the Way Down™
Reviews.Content: Could not be happier with the Olympus Stylus 9000 12 MP Digital Camera with 10x Wide Angle Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black). With a price point of $179, there are plenty of elite features, principally: 12 mega pixels resolution, a remarkable 10x optical zoom, and wide angle capability.  Canon and Kodak have responded with similarly featured cameras at about the same price, but offerings from Sony, Nikon, Fujifilm and Panasonic cost as much as $110 more. It should also be noted that these features - 12mp, 10x optical zoom - constitute impressive leaps in point-and-shoot camera sophistication, compared to what was available just three or four years ago.And this camera is so gorgeous! Sleek black with silver trim, it might be the best looking digital camera I've ever seen. The Stylus 9000's 2.7 inch LCD display is three-tenths of an inch smaller than the 3-incher some of the others have, but the looks of this camera more than compensate.

Reviews.Title: best point and shoot
Reviews.Author: arob
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera even though its a point and shoot. It has 12 mega pixels and a good zoom which is one of the reasons i bought this camera. I also bought this camera because it has an in-camera panorama feature. I later found out that it also does a grant job with up close pictures like flowers and such. it has three shooting settings for it in case you want to get really close like i do: normal, macro, and super-macro. i didn't even know it had this feature and once i discovered it i started getting compliments on my photos.

Reviews.Title: Solid Camera
Reviews.Author: Donald Perry III "Don P."
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It has a durable feel to it, while still looking sleek and polished. Picture quality is great, and the image stabilizer and sports/action mode is usually solid enough to take good pictures of people/things that are on the move. Panoramic mode is pretty impressive for taking wide angle pictures. Overall I am very impressed with this camera. Great price for a quality camera.

Reviews.Title: Plympus Stylus 9000 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Al Elkins "Music lover, Computer & Photograph...
Reviews.Content: I used my new Olympus Stylus 9000 digital camera on my recent cruise for the first time, and I was very satified with it's results.  It was also very easy to use.I was also very impressed with how helpful the Olympus Customer Service was when I called them for assistance.

Reviews.Title: great full feature camera.
Reviews.Author: Mike Feldman "camera amature"
Reviews.Content: The Stylus 9000 has many great features that will always keep it current.  I do wish the built in memory had more capacity

Reviews.Title: A perfect Camera for anyone
Reviews.Author: Jennifer A. Pedersen
Reviews.Content: I have bought many digital camera's over the years. I am always trying to keep up with technology! I have to say this camera is so perfect for me. I have a toddler and its quick to capture her. I was having issues with my past camera becuase it wasn't quick enough. This camera produces quality clear photos. I love that it takes people pictures so well indoors and outdoors. It is east to use and so small it is so easy to take with you where ever you go.This camera is for anyone from parents, to someone going on a vacation to just someone that enjoys taking pictures all the time. I love this camera for its portablity and easy use.This camera also ranks high with the videos it takes. I would of never thought it would give my vidoe camera a run for the money but that is exactly what it has done.I am really enjoying this camera and all its super easy functions that it offers.

Reviews.Title: Worth it.
Reviews.Author: S. Colenso
Reviews.Content: I am what you would consider a novice as far as cameras go. I did a lot of research to make up for it. With that stated; I love this camera. It is everything I could ever want and much more. It is easy to use, great pictures, and very portable. My one complaint would be that you have to hold the button down for a second or two to take a picture. While this is very annoying, I would definately buy this camera again looking back on it. The price can't be beat for this kind of quality. I would recommend getting the kit with it. It costs roughly $70 more, but it is excellent and also totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: B. Yeager
Reviews.Content: Great camera, Very happy with this purchase! Light weight easy to carry and loaded with features. The zoom is incredible for a point & shoot. You won't be sorry with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Small But Effective Camera
Reviews.Author: Janet S.
Reviews.Content: Enjoy taking pictures with small camera.  Self timer very effective.  Great having Image Stabilization.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love my little Epson Stylus 9000 camera.
Reviews.Author: Florence Thompson "F. P. Thompson"
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful camera.  After I purchased it at Amazon.com, I checked it out at Best Buy.  It was almost $100 more expensive.My last portable camera was a Kodak, which also had a 10" optical zoom.  I loved that feature and wanted it again. Unfortunately, I dropped that camera and it stopped working.This camera is even better than that one.  The zoom feature is awesome as it  actually zooms out instead of just having a little button as a zoom feature.Also, it is easy to use and the picture clarity is excellent.  So far, I have been 100% satisfied with all of my purchases from Amazon.com; it's truly a trustworthy on-line company.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: Nice camera, & compact too.The bad: very dissapointing that the zoom does not work in video mode.

Reviews.Title: Not Good Enough
Reviews.Author: A. Klein "lovetoshop"
Reviews.Content: Just took pictures comparing the Olympus 9000 and the Canon SX200is.  Hands down the Canon outperformed.  Not only was it an easier camera to use and learn but the picture quality was much better.  The Olympus in poor lighting didn't focus well and was very grainy.  Actually the camera I'm replacing took better pictures.  The Canon had better zoom, the colors were crisp and the pictures turned out great even in the low lighting.  The Olympus was a little faster in being ready for the next picture.  I've been reading reviews and going back and forth for months now on these cameras, finally bought them both and the Canon wins.

Reviews.Title: Olympus versus Lumix
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I am just a snap happy picture taker who likes an ultra-small camera with quick shutter speed. I returned the Olympus after evaluating picture quality with the zoom, and because I did not like the feel of the camera in my hand. The Olympus picture quality is excellent until you get beyond 8x zoom; the blurring around the edges is very noticeable even while taking the shot, and the colors fade.  The camera felt bulky and heavy compared to the Lumix FH20, and is more expensive. Overall a beautiful camera, just not right for my type of picture taking.A side note about the Olympus brand; they design their battery and memory cards so you cannot substitue a generic brand.

Reviews.Title: Terrible indoor pictures
Reviews.Author: Sweetheart "Tweety"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about 6 months ago and have read and re-read the instructions.  I have been using it on at least a weekly basis.  I love to take all types of pictures and my friends have relied on me to take pictures of special events.After looking at other brands and styles, I bought this camera because:1. Brand name2. 10x optical wide zoom -very important3. Video and panorama option-important4. Compact size-very important5. Easy to use-very importantI have made good use of this camera in many different situations and I would like to give you my opinion of my findings.The outdoor pictures in bright sunlight come out magnificent in all modes.Cloudy, I have to make adjustments-Auto does not take the best pictures.  This creates a problem since I cannot just rely on point and shoot.Taking pictures of children are just about impossible in any mode.  When I click to take the picture there is a delay of many seconds which by the time the camera decides to take the picture, the child is not even in the frame.  Sport mode is not a good option either.  I tried it.This camera takes the MOST awful indoor pictures of any camera I have seen.  Disposable cameras take better pictures.  I am not exaggerating or adding salt and pepper to my opinion.  My friends have told me the same thing.  No matter what mode, or flash setting I have it on my pictures all come out grainy, dark, not clear---TERRIBLE!!!  I have again gone back to the instruction book and played with different setting and even gave it to a friend who is very familiar with photography and he could not get a good indoor picture either.In closing-I would never buy another Olympus product/camera again.  Any tips would be appreciated.

Reviews.Title: good brand
Reviews.Author: D. Shaw "Oh meow"
Reviews.Content: This is very nice compact zoom lens camera, but it is not easy to hold still while viewing LCD to take pictures. I still prefer viewfinder much easier than LCD.

Reviews.Title: Gets the job done, but not always pretty
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: The white balance on this is odd and I don't know how to change it.  Flash is a little bright and washes out the pictures.Camera is  good sized and has a nice zoom associated with it.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera.
Reviews.Author: Linda S. Holt "Leehah"
Reviews.Content: You can't beat Olympus for a point and shoot camera. I love my Canon for my important photos but to throw something in my purse to have at all times this is the one. It has a beautification feature that any woman would love. I too our company photos with this camera to put on our badges and everyone looked like they were photoshopped.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jeff Petersimes
Reviews.Content: This product is well made and saves me alot of headaches, I would recommend this product to anyone that likes to save money!

Reviews.Title: Love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Luis Canelo
Reviews.Content: Small, stylish, great power, portable, etc... for a photograpy entusiast, this is a great way to start, now i would like to have a more robust and pro camera... in my wish list for next year!

Reviews.Title: Isn't worth the money.
Reviews.Author: gemini "gemini"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my Europe trip. I was disappointed and wanted to return but by the time I got back to the US, the 90-day return window had passed. The automatic mode doesn't work very well, especially in low light setting. In low light setting, you have to select a special mode and it takes a very long time to capture the picture. During that long time, if you shake your hands ever so lightly, the image comes out blurry. The panoramic mode doesn't work well either. My galaxy S3 takes much much better picture than this camera. This camera isn't worth the money.

Reviews.Title: I Love my Camera
Reviews.Author: Felida Mendez
Reviews.Content: The product is very good. It's in a good state.I proof it and I didn't find any problems.I'm thinking about to buy another one.

Reviews.Title: works like a charm
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I got this for a trip to Disney as my old camera died.  I'll admit it took me a little getting used to since I was so used to my old Olympus camera and things were in slightly different places, but I figured it out quick enough.  Pictures came out amazing, including night time and fireworks shots that never came out with my old camera.  Battery lasted the entire day, which was a bonus considering how many pictures I took.  Very, very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Replaces a lost Sony, but not as good
Reviews.Author: Frances Saad
Reviews.Content: I haven't used it enough for a full review, but I am not thrilled with the quality of the photos compared to my beloved Sony which was lost this year.

Reviews.Title: My Kodak Has Spoiled Me
Reviews.Author: R. Foley
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because my Kodak DX6490 is too large to fit in my pocket and too heavy to where on my neck for long periods. I wanted something small, light weight and took great pictures. I'm not sure if you can have both (small and takes great pictures). I guess my Kodak has spoiled me. The Stylus takes good pictures and has many features, but does not have the picture quality that my  DX6490 has. I will use it when I don't want to carry a heavy camera around my neck all day and it works fairly well with good daytime lighting. But distant photos and in the shade or low lighting the pictures are so-so. Like I said, It might be that I am use to great pictures from my DX6490 other then good pictures from the Stylus 9000.

Reviews.Title: I hope this is not a lemon!
Reviews.Author: Marilyn E. Burr "lyn burr"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera less than a month and have had to send it back to the company for repairs.  The zoom is not working and I was on a trip to Longwood gardens and the camera would not focus so most of the photos I took that I thought I would use for paintings are out of focus.  I am really disappointed! Also the controls are hard to identify.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000
Reviews.Author: bluemoon
Reviews.Content: Great little camera the pictures come out great and it is very easy to use. This is the 3rd Olympus that I have owned and each model is better than the last.

Reviews.Title: Worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Camera Ready (always on me or in my purse)
Reviews.Content: I had this camera model from last Christmas till late July. The camera got beaten up pretty bad on a missions trip in July, and started malfunctioning in August (a day after I returned to the U.S.). The battery life is GREAT. The pictures are better, or as good, as any digital camera out there. I'm pretty picky about CLEAR pics, and this camera does a good job. I even leave it on AUTO alot and the pics turn out great!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - Great Zoom
Reviews.Author: E. Shipman "shopper"
Reviews.Content: 10 X optical zoom + digital zoom for viewing - Takes great pictures and videos

Reviews.Title: excellent camera at a great price
Reviews.Author: miguel angel bustos
Reviews.Content: very good buy I do not regret, excellent pictures, I be inaccuracies with the quality of the pictures both day and night very good easy to use, the zoom incredible, really recommend it 100%, as I've had to olympus olympus cameras above and the service is good anywhere in the world, atleast here in Venezuela

Reviews.Title: I LIKE MY CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jeanette Santiago "GADGET GIRL"
Reviews.Content: I LIKE MY CAMERA A LOT, GREAT QUALITY, A LITTLE THICKER AND HEAVY SO I FEEL I HAVE TO BE XTRA CAREFUL NOT TO DROP IT. LOVE THE BIG SCREEN. HAS A LOT OF THINGS  U CAN DO WITH IT BUT TO GET THERE I TAKE FOR EVER. NOT EASY TO USE UNLESS U JUST POINT AND SHOOT. I ALWAYS HAVE TO GO TO THE MANUAL.  TAKES A LILL LONGER TO TAKE THE PICT, U HAVE TO WAIT FOR THE BEEP SOUND AND THEN PUSH THE BUTTON ALL AWAY DOWN, AND THEN SECONDS LATER TAKES THE PICT. MAYBE IM TOO PICKY BUT THE QUALITY OF THE PICT IS GREAT. TO DOWLOAD IT TO UR PC IT IS SOOOO FAST. U JUST CONNECT THE CABLE FROM THE CAM TO THE PC , CHOOSE PC ON UR CAMERA  AND WALLA!!! LOOOOOOOOOVE THE "BEUTIFY" BUTTON, GIVES THAT AIRBRUSH LOOK, MAKING UR FACE LOOK SMOOTHER, LESS IMPERFECTIONS, BLEMISHES ECT. AND STILL KEEPS BOTH PICTURES . I LIKE MY CAMERA A LOT, ITS JUST IM NORMALLY A WIZ WITH MY "TOYS" I GET TO KNOW EVERY BUTTON EVERY THING IT CAN DO , THIS ONE ITS A LILL MORE TIME TO GET TO KNOW. BUT IF GREAT PICTURES IS WHAT U WANT, THIS ONE WILL DO IT.

Reviews.Title: Not simple to use
Reviews.Author: William D. Sylvester
Reviews.Content: Even tho camera's description mentioned that the camera was simple to use. I found that I needed to refer to the directions for several hours before I could have a basic knowledge of it's operation.  Also, I was disappointed that I needed to go and buy a picture storage unit, for about $20,otherwise I could only take about 12 pictures using internal storage.  Otherwise, at this point, we like the camera very much.

Reviews.Title: My first digital camera
Reviews.Author: M. B. King
Reviews.Content: I'm just getting started with the new camera I received for my birthday.  I'm a bit of a klutz and the number of options is a bit overwhelming but with the next week in cabin in the North Woods of Wisconsin, I should have lots of time and great scenes to practice.

Reviews.Title: great but no hdmi hook-up
Reviews.Author: C. farrell IV "fyrehart"
Reviews.Content: Well, I just bought camera. Came quickly with damage. Works great one of the best cameras ever owmed. It takes great picture even when one after another, and does that quite quickly too. Reason for a four instead of five is because they claim it can be hdmi hooked-up to TV by a mini hdmi cable inserted into camera port, which if there is one then I must be blind or something, because I have not found it yet. If anybody knows where at or doesn't exsist let me know, please. Other than that it is an exceptional camera.

Reviews.Title: miko_bosnia
Reviews.Author: Electron
Reviews.Content: First of all nice looking good features, when I opened it amazing, then I see the features, really good. But after I played with camera couple days I wasn't satisfied at all.The worst thing is focus, that shocked me when I moved pictures on my laptop to see them. They look blurry , they are not sharp at all, some of pictures are... but I wasn't satisfied at all, when I see some smaller cameras from my friends like Cannon or Nikon, about 3x optic, when I compare them whit this 9000 Olympus, not good at all. I'm not a beginner with cameras, so I know exact how to take a focused picture, no matter what I tried, they are not so good as I thought it gonna be.I see some people are complaining about grainy pictures, I dont see that problem.Another bad thing about this camera it doesn't have optic zoom in Video mode, only digital, so it sucks.From me about camera and stars:5 star for design, applications, features, easy to use3 star only I'm giving is for bad Focus ( not as I thought it's gonna be).

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 9000 12MP
Reviews.Author: ricky s
Reviews.Content: Great camera. Easy to use. This is my third Olympus digital camera. I've been pleased with them all but this is the best.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great.
Reviews.Author: 314dc
Reviews.Content: I hve grown to respect the Olympus name. I have had a few of them now and after replacing my last point and shoot I have to say that there were a few drawbacks. For one, the max shutter speed used to be 3200, but for unknown reasons they've brought it back to 1600. Of course you risk grainy, pixilation, and noise at that speed. but in some instances you can pull it off. It's better to have than to have not. Also the color temperature seems to be gauged off during some dominant flash situations. Also the cover for the USB connection is a cheap rubber instead of the metal door that was used on other models recently. It is used often so the stronger the better. But don't get me wrong, it is still a good camera. And most of my complaints are trivial more than real problems. The casing is solid and the shutter reaction time is on the money. I also love the advance panoramic features that allows you to combine photos in the camera itself. The interface is much the same as convenient and reliable as other Olympus models. They have added a "beauty" quick setting so you can skip the tedious setup to grab a quick portrait. All in all it is nice but could be more. I still prefer Olympus to most other point and shoots.

Reviews.Title: Not for zooming.
Reviews.Author: Brenda Gerena
Reviews.Content: Have owned this camera for over 12 months. Great for close up shots but very poor quality when using the optical zoom, the pictures are always dark and granny.  Not a camera for any distance shooting.

Reviews.Title: Just what I needed at a great price.
Reviews.Author: Nancy J "Ms Boss"
Reviews.Content: I'm extremely pleased with the quality of my photos. AND, with the ease of use -- even for the advanced features.  I have fantastic shots from Alaska, without carrying around my larger, heavy SLR!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Joonho Park "moderation"
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect. My wife is satisfied with that. The camera is at home and now I am at office so I can not load anything. Later I will upload some figures and movies if possible. But I think I can not take a picture of camera itself.

Reviews.Title: Worst camera I've ever owned
Reviews.Author: J. Rod Hatch
Reviews.Content: I  bought this camera to take to Kenya last year thinking that I would come back with high quality photos.  I was wrong.  Not having a view finder was the first problem I had to deal with.  In the bright sunlight you can't see the screen, so you can't frame your photo. Various functions of the camera don't work in all modes.  I took the camera to Italy this year hoping for better results.  I shot all day but when I went to review my photos, there were none there. Good thing that I had taken my Canon Powershot with me. I understand why it now only cost half of what I paid for it. I've owned a lot of cameras in my lifetime but the 9000 is trash.

Reviews.Title: An Exciting Upgrade from my Stylus 740!
Reviews.Author: Roxanne Sitarz "hyena owner"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an upgrade with the newer Olympus features, but was disappointed with how basic and inefficient the newest feature selection is on the current cameras. I had purchased a 7040 and was completely disappointed with it...I tried to like it, but I ended up returning it to Best Buy within 3 daysWhen I found the 9000, I was pleased that it still had the features I liked best-the roller-wheel setting selections  the one-touch simple command button. (Rather than scroll down a menu ont he camera, u simply press right, left, up or down!)I have only used this briefly, because I am always overly cautious with my new cameras-but give me a month & I'll have a full report! so far, I really like this camera!

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Eleni "Eleni"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my purchase.  The camera came new in the box and on time.  Quite pleased with the quality of the camera as well.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Issam N. Mansour
Reviews.Content: used few times so far, easy to use, good pictures, wide lens, no wow effect though.

Reviews.Title: be aware it's xD card
Reviews.Author: A. Bahhary
Reviews.Content: it says it supports xD card...thought SD card is supported but it's not. btw, i don't know what's an xD card, lol!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but I may have to read the manual
Reviews.Author: Lorne Truscott
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, but I can't give it the glowing review I wanted to, because the images seem to be "washed out".  Looks like I may need to read the manual and check the settings.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brian Jones
Reviews.Content: The camera is wonderful to use. Very easy and takes great pictures. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is a little trouble with the delivery. But a few phone calls took care of what turned out to be a little "glitch".

Reviews.Title: Not Impressed
Reviews.Author: K. Sylvia
Reviews.Content: The reason I returned this camera is the close up pictures indoors are washed out. My finger kept covering the flash - it's in a bad spot. The subject is far away without using the zoom. The power button is really small. I am purchasing the Sony Cybershot H20.
